data.title: China Laos Railway 2024- Kunming – Vientiane Train D887/888
data.meta_description: The China-Laos Railway is now in operation. Learn about the Kunming – Vientiane Train and discover the highlights of this incredible railway journey.
data.text:
China-Laos railway

The China-Laos Railway is now in operation, and tickets are available for purchase. The high-speed Kunming to Vientiane bullet train runs daily. If you're considering a trip to China and Laos and need assistance booking transportation and planning your Laos tour itinerary, don't hesitate to contact us.

One of the most exciting developments of the China-Laos Railway is the introduction of the Kunming – Vientiane Train D887/888, a train that will traverse the length of the railway, connecting Kunming in China to Vientiane in Laos. In this article, we'll take a closer look at this train, its route, and how to buy tickets.

China Laos Railway Map

China-Laos railway map

If you want to see the route more clearly from Laos to China, we suggested that you can search for more details about Laos map. The China-Laos Railway will begin in Kunming, the capital of China's Yunnan province. From there, it will head south, crossing into Laos at the Boten-Mohan border crossing. The railway will then continue southwards, passing through the cities of Luang Prabang and Vang Vieng before finally reaching its terminus in Vientiane. The total length of the railway is approximately 1035 kilometers, and the entire journey is expected to take around 10 hours.

China Laos Railway Schedule & Ticket Price

China-Laos railway inside

The Kunming – Vientiane Train D887/888 runs once daily, departing from Kunming at 8:08 am and arriving in Vientiane at 5:38 pm. The return journey will depart from Vientiane at 10:30 am and arrive in Kunming at 7:38 pm. The train is expected to make stops in several cities along the route, including Luang Prabang and Vang Vieng.

As for the ticket prices, the First-class seat is CNY 864, and the Second-class seat costs CNY542.

How to buy China-Laos railway tickets?

Buy ticket on-line

There are two recommended ways to buy tickets for the Kunming – Vientiane Train D887/888:

Buy online with official platforms

The most convenient way to purchase tickets is to do so online. The official website for the China Railway Corporation is the best place to start through China's website 12306. cn and its App “Tielu 12306” or Laos's LCR Ticket App. We can also help you book the train tickets.

Buy Tickets at Train Station

If you prefer to buy tickets in person, you can do so at the train station. However, be aware that the train is likely to be popular, so there may be long queues. It's also good to arrive at the station early to avoid missing your train.

Highlights of the China-Laos Railway

Railway road

This incredible railway journey spans over 400 miles and is one of the most impressive transportation projects in the region. Here are some of the highlights of the China-Laos Railway:

Scenic views: The train journey offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains, valleys, and rivers. Passengers can expect to see stunning landscapes, quaint towns, and rural villages as they travel through the heart of Southeast Asia.

Cross-border travel: The China-Laos Railway is a major international transportation project that connects two countries. It's the first railway in Laos and is a significant step towards increasing trade and tourism between the two nations.

Modern amenities: The trains on the China-Laos Railway are modern and comfortable, with air conditioning, spacious seating, and clean facilities. The bullet train from Kunming to Vientiane is one of the fastest trains in Southeast Asia, with a maximum speed of 160 km/h.

Cultural experience: The railway journey provides an opportunity to experience the unique culture and way of life in China and Laos. Passengers can explore the two nations' local food, customs, and traditions during their journey.

Minorities dancing performance

You can travel from Beijing to Luang Prabang. Start in Beijing, where you will visit Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, walk along the Hutongs, and hike the stunning Great Wall at Jinshanling.

Travel to the Summer Palace and take a high-speed train to Shanghai, where you will discover the city's charm and elegance, including the Former French Concession and the Bund.

Then, fly to Kunming in Yunnan province, where you will visit the Stone Forest and Old Street before taking a cross-border high-speed train to Luang Prabang in Laos. In Luang Prabang, you will explore World Heritage sites, attend the morning alms-giving ceremony, and visit the beautiful Kuang Si Waterfall.

The China-Laos Railway is a fantastic transportation project that offers a unique and unforgettable travel experience. It combines modern amenities, breathtaking scenery, and cultural exploration, making it an ideal way to explore the beauty and diversity of Southeast Asia.

Tips to Take China Laos Railway

Laos visa

The Kunming – Vientiane Train D887/888 offers a unique opportunity to explore both China and Laos in a single trip. Here are some tips for planning your journey:

Get your visas prepared for advance – be sure to obtain the necessary visas for both China and Laos before you travel.

If you plan on taking the cross-border train from China to Laos, it's important to know that foreign tourists must obtain a visa beforehand. It's worth noting that neither the Mohan Railway Station Port nor the Boten Railway Station Port offer visa-on-arrival services, so be sure to check the visa requirements and apply for one well in advance of your trip.

In order to apply for Laos’s visa in Kunming, you'll need to visit the Consulate of Laos in Kunming, which is located on Caiyunbei Lu in the Guandu District. Make sure to keep their office hours in mind.

Monday to Friday: 09:00 – 11:30 14:00 – 16:00

In addition to the Laos Consulate located in Kunming, there are several other places where you can apply for a visa to Laos, such as the Laos Consulates in Jinghong, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Nanning, Changsha, and Hong Kong.

Allow plenty of time – the entire journey from Kunming to Vientiane takes around 10 hours, so plan your itinerary accordingly.

Plan your stops – the train makes stops in several cities along the route, including Luang Prabang and Vang Vieng. Consider spending a day or two in each city to make the most of your trip.

Pack appropriately – the weather in Yunnan province can be quite different from that in Laos, so be sure to pack accordingly.

FAQs about Taking Kunming to Vientiane Train

Train to Laos

Q: Is there food and drink available on the train?

A: Yes, there will be food and drink available for purchase on the train. However, it's always a good idea to bring some snacks and water with you, just in case.

Q: Are there power outlets on the train?

A: Yes, there are power outlets on the train, so you can charge your devices during the journey.

Q: Is the train accessible for people with disabilities?

A: The railway authorities have not yet released information about accessibility on the train. However, it's always a good idea to contact the railway company in advance to discuss any special requirements you may have.

Q: What should I bring with me on the train?

A: It's a good idea to bring a small bag with essentials such as snacks, water, a power bank, and any necessary medication. You should also bring your passport and any necessary visas.

Luggage Allowances:

Adult: 20 kg

Child (including those with a free ticket): 10 kg

Diplomat: 35 kg

Baggage size: the three dimensions' total cannot exceed 130 cm, i.e. medium suitcase size, typically 60x43x26 cm (24x17x10.5”)

In the End
